ArticleTitle.sentence: Monochloramine inhibits phorbol ester-inducible neutrophil respiratory burst activation and T cell interleukin-2 receptor expression by inhibiting inducible protein kinase C activity.

AbstractText.sentence: Monochloramine derivatives are long lived physiological oxidants produced by neutrophils during the respiratory burst.

event.clue: Monochloramine derivatives are long lived physiological oxidants produced by neutrophils during the respiratory burst.

AbstractText.sentence: The effects of chemically prepared monochloramine (NH2Cl) on protein kinase C (PKC) and PKC-mediated cellular responses were studied in elicited rat peritoneal neutrophils and human Jurkat T cells.

AbstractText.sentence: Neutrophils pretreated with NH2Cl (30-50 microM) showed a marked decrease in the respiratory burst activity induced by phorbol 12-myristate 13-acetate (PMA), which is a potent PKC activator.

AbstractText.sentence: The NH2Cl-treated neutrophils showed a decrease in both PKC activity and PMA-induced phosphorylation of a 47-kDa protein, which corresponds to the cytosolic factor of NADPH oxidase, p47(phox).
